dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.itf.MediaInterface
dataStructure.description:
This is an abstract class that serves as the superclass for all physical interfaces (physical in the sense that they are real interfaces that can be instantiated - they are still logical entities) whose functionality is dependent on a particular transmission medium (e.g., Ethernet vs. ATM). It serves as a convenient aggregation point for running different relationships that affect its subclasses, thereby avoiding having to instantiate multiple relationships that are essentially the same.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: MediaInterface

child.name: mtuSupported
child.description:
This is an integer attribute that defines the size of the maximum transmission unit (MTU) that can be supported by this interface.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: mtuSupported

child.name: mtuCurrent
child.description:
This is an integer attribute that defines the size of hte maximum transmission unit (MTU) that is currently set for this particular interface.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: mtuCurrent

child.name: supportsMLPPP
child.description:
This is a Boolean attribute that, if TRUE, signifies this Media Interface of being able to support MLPPP as defined in RFC 1990.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: supportsMLPPP

child.name: logicalInterface
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association ContainsLogicalInterfaces

This association end is optional
child.label: logicalInterface

child.name: mediaInterface
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association InterfacesInMLPPPConfig

This association end is optional
child.label: mediaInterface

child.name: mediaInterface1
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation shared

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association InterfacesInMLPPPConfig

This association end is optional
child.label: mediaInterface1
